data.title: Still thinking of the Fuji Apple Sake!
data.text:
I was here in 2015 for a week for business training, I of course had to get some sushi! Their 911 is to die for, but what I remember most is the Fuji Apple Sake, tasted and went down just like apple juice! 
I also really liked that they had red bean ice cream on their menu. I am Korean and have had red bean ice cream in Korea, this was very close to what I had there! It may sound odd, but seriously, give it a try!

data.title: Good lunch
data.text: Here again in fargo for business. I always look out for good sushi and a coworker reccomended this place. The server was very good. I dont recomend the spicy crab roll, or the khani salad. Just cheap fake crab, not very good. But the eel role was great and the other specialilty role i had, don't remember, was great. Overall quite happy, will go again.

data.title: Really Surprised, in a Positive Way
data.text: In our travels, we are always on the lookout for acceptable sushi, so we were delighted to find fairly good reviews of a sushi restaurant in Fargo, of all places. With some trepidation, we decided to give it a try for lunch during our one day in Fargo. The setting was pleasant, if a little on the dark side. There is a lot of seating and we were seated promptly. Service was fast and responsive during our entire meal experience. We always order hot tea. We were disappointed to get a beat up pot with hot water and presented with two tea bags and coffee cups. Too bad they do not have a decent brewed green tea with Japanese style tea cups. Oh well. We ordered a seaweed salad to share and each ordered one of their speciality rolls. The seaweed salad arrived promptly and was of a decent size to share. It was very nicely dressed and presented. A real hit. Shortly our rolls arrived and they were very large and nicely presented. They were delicious. One test is the rice and this rice was done very well and was fresh. The fish and all ingredients tasted fresh. So, overall we had a great lunch of sushi in Fargo.

data.title: Good Sushi, Lots Of Seating, Nice Atmosphere
data.text: The staff are helpful, the food is good, and the location is fantastic for an evening downtown. They have a decent selection of sushi and drinks. An excellent way to start a night and a great place for a first date...and subsequent dates. And birthdays. And 21st's.

data.title: Excellent quality, long waits
data.text: This is not a fast dining experience. It typically takes quite a while to be seated, and the meal itself can take two hours. That said, the service is wonderful and the sushi is (in my opinion) the best in town. The atmosphere is perfect for a relaxing evening, but not ideal for a lunch. The lighting is fairly dark. The prices are reasonable.

data.title: Salmon Bento Box Was a Hit
data.text: There are lots of choices in this hip downtown spot. I went with the Bento Box because it gave me a variety of items. The salmon was quite flavorful and nicely done and the salad was crisp and fresh. I wish the two bits of sushi had been larger, but otherwise things were quite good.

data.title: Going back for seconds!!
data.text: High standards, amazing food, and super service! Very relaxed atmosphere. Spring rolls, miso, ahi tuna salad, specialty roll, nigiri and wine...ALL SPECTACULAR!

data.title: Fresh and Fantastic
data.text: Big fan of sashimi and without a doubt this is the best in and around Fargo, Reasonably priced. Corona Roll and Red Dragon roll were stellar. Sapporo on tap. Doesn't get much better

data.title: Great Sushi for so far from water
data.text: Wasabi has awesome sushi for Fargo. It is fresh and inventive (get the speciality rolls!) but it isn't quite like sushi in places like Chicago or Dan Diego. Nevertheless one of my favorite restauants here. Great for everything from business meals to casual dining.

data.title: Yum!!!
data.text: I don't eat animal protein (plus I have a shellfish allergy) so I ordered the fried tofu and vegetable roll. Both were DELICIOUS!  My boyfriend had never tried sushi so the waitress suggested the spider roll and he really liked it. He also had the miso soup and enjoyed that too. We'll be back!!!

data.title: Sushi Downtown
data.text: Wasabi Sushi and Asian Grill is my favorite sushi place downtown. And very reasonable - quiet little place

data.title: Best true sushi in Fargo Moorhead
data.text: I stopped for lunch and sat at the sushi bar.  Quick prep awesome fresh sushi was the happy result.  I like the laid back vibe also.  Try the Ahi Poke off the app menu for a true sushi treat.

data.title: YOU NEED TO TRY
data.text:
The food is ABSOLUTELY AMAZING! 
When you first walk in, you're actually in the seating area for their sister, drunken noodle. You just keep walking and you'll see the sushi portion very quickly, directly in front of you. The host will seat you. Inside, there is modern art on the walls, sometimes framed. Across from the door, on the far side of the room,is their beer bar. 
I ordered sushi, while my companion ordered chicken lolipops. WOW. The sauce makes you think you've gone to heaven and back. The chicken lolipops are delicious, but that sauce combination! Try the garlic sauce, you will NOT be dissapointed!

data.title: Wasabi Is A Local Favorite in Fargo
data.text: Wasabi was one of our go-to places when living in Fargo.  Good food and friendly staff to serve.  Not perfect in every way but local, nice, tasty and like any other sushi place, it might take a while if the order in front of you is a Boat (a menu item) but you'll be happy when your food comes. We went often and always left happy.

data.title: Great Food, Service, and Prices!
data.text: The sushi rolls that we had were excellent and the server even recommended a few that were great too. The prices for the roles were less than most places but the quality was very good. We will definitely be back!

data.title: Very good and improved professionalism
data.text: This restaurant always produced good food but service and professionalism used to be poor and spotty. No more. The level of efficiency and professionalism is like a regular restaurant rather than the amateurish job that it was doing. Good for them. Portions are generous for Japanese an restaurant.  Will go again. Nice improvement noted.

data.title: Great
data.text: Service was great. Food was great. Waited forever for the food! Always a little dicey getting sushi in the Midwest but place seemed packed so obviously had a good rep.

data.title: The sushi,poke,and crispy pork ramen were on point!
data.text: Loved the music, atmosphere, friendly service, and most of all the food! This place met and exceeded my expectations.

data.title: Delicious sushi
data.text: The most delicious sushi in a most unexpected place! The decor - eh... The neighborhood - quiet... The service was fabulous, and they brought me sushi as good as any I've had anywhere. Go ahead - you certainly won't be disappointed.

data.title: Awesome Food
data.text:
The décor might throw you off but the food is great. Wasabi sushi is connected to Drunken Noodle. You share the menu.
The décor is not the best but the service and staff are great.
The sushi was one of the best I have eaten. All the rolls and sashimi are good. Sake !!!! well depends on one's taste. They do have a lot of flavoured infused sake. 
The food from Drunken Noodle is also very good.
